1 Women are regarded as being at high risk of developing hypertension and pre-eclampsia if they have one or 
more of the following risk factors: obesity, previous pre-eclampsia, diabetes, chronic hypertension, renal disease, 
autoimmune disease, multiple pregnancy, and either adolescent or late pregnancy. This is not an exhaustive list, but 
can be adapted/complemented based on the local epidemiology of pre-eclampsia (see 189).
